snippet: Jon Sebastiani, in the fourth generation of a Sonoma Valley wine family, sees his new company, Krave Jerky, as a way to change attitudes about a snack food.
abstract: Nicole LaPorte Prototype column; Jon Sebastiani, fourth generation of Sonoma Valley wine family, sees his new company Krave Jerky as a way to change attitudes about dried-meat jerky; is positioning his product, available in 15,000 stores, as healthy snack that is as highbrow as vintage cabernet.
lead_paragraph: Jon Sebastiani, in the fourth generation of a Sonoma Valley wine family, sees his new company, Krave Jerky, as a way to change attitudes about a snack food.

headline.seo: Krave Jerky Seeks to Upgrade a Snack’s Image
headline.main: Cabernet and Jerky, in the Same Sentence
headline.print_headline: Cabernet and Jerky, In the Same Sentence
